intro: Acrotome belckii, commonly known as the African firecracker, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking red and orange tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are pollinated by birds, particularly sunbirds, due to their shape and color. Acrotome belckii is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
